thread.title: Wash. State stabbing victim, 17, was going to be a father
thread.title_full: Wash. State stabbing victim, 17, was going to be a father

author: ELIZABETH ELIZALDE
title: Wash. State stabbing victim, 17, was going to be a father
text:
Washington state 17-year-old boy allegedly stabbed by twin brother was going to be a father Wash. State stabbing victim, 17, was going to be a father NEW YORK DAILY NEWS  42 PM 
A 17-year-old Washington State boy who was allegedly stabbed to death by his twin brother is being remembered as a kind soul whose girlfriend is pregnant with their daughter. 
Shane Wachter and his twin brother Shawn Wachter – both from Coulee City – had argued before Shawn allegedly stabbed Shane in the chest Sunday morning, KXLY-TV reported . 
Deputies with the Grant County Sheriff’s Office were called to a home around 2:30 a.m. and Shane was later pronounced dead at a local hospital. 
The family of Shane girlfriend, Haylee Hayduk, released a statement saying the couple is expecting a baby girl. Shane Wachter, 17, was fatally stabbed Sunday morning. (Facebook) 
“Due to the importance of our daughter’s health and for Shane and Haylee’s unborn daughter, Violet Grace, we are asking that everyone please remember to give Haylee the space and added prayers that she will need during this extremely sad and difficult time,” the statement read . 
The crime shook the small town and those who knew the brothers say they were inseparable. 
“They were so close, they loved each other,” a friend of the twins told the TV station. “They were the stereotypical brothers, who they'd fight in the backyard, and 30 minutes later they'd be fine.” Shane Wachter (right), 17, and girlfriend Haylee Hayduk (left). Hayduk is reportedly pregnant with the couple's daughter. (Facebook) 
A friend said Shane was trying to turn his life around before the birth of his daughter. 
Twin of woman who fell off Oculus escalator sings teary tribute 
“He really wanted to be a better person all the time and he had a kid on the way, and he just wanted to be a great father,” said Michael Evans. 
Shawn, 17, faces charges of manslaughter and domestic assault. He’s expected to appear in court Tuesday. A motive for the stabbing remains unknown. 
An autopsy to determined Shane’s cause of death is also scheduled for Tuesday. Tags:
